title: 108_hr4550
content: The Act titled "Safe, Efficient, Coordinated, Unified, Revitalized, Enhanced Visa Waiver Act" requires visa waiver participants to electronically submit biographical information. The Secretary of Homeland Security must establish an electronic system for visa waiver program participants to submit biographical information before entering the US. The system must provide an eligibility determination within 30 minutes for nonimmigrant visitors. The Secretary of Homeland Security must establish an electronic system for visa waiver program participants to submit biographical information before entering the US. The system shall include carrier obligations, deployment as soon as possible, and a fee to be charged to eligible aliens to cover system costs. The Secretary of Homeland Security must consult with a private sector group with expertise in travel, tourism, privacy, national security, or computer security issues when developing the electronic system for visa waiver program participants. The system's fee should cover full costs of establishment and operation. The Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act requires the installation of equipment and software at all ports of entry into the United States for biometric comparison and authentication of visas, travel documents, and passports. The deadline for implementation is October 26, 2005. The Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act deadline for technology standard implementation is extended to 2005. Additionally, a limited good faith waiver is introduced. The Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act allows for limited good faith waivers for countries making progress towards meeting passport requirements, with a maximum of 2 extensions granted for up to 6 months each. Factors for progress include certification by the Secretary of State. The Secretary of State will certify whether a country has made efforts to meet passport requirements by specific deadlines. The Secretary of Homeland Security will issue an initial report on countries' progress by October 26, 2005. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with the Secretary of State, will issue a final report on countries' progress in meeting passport requirements by April 25, 2006. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 303 of the Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act is amended to replace "Attorney General" with "Secretary of Homeland Security".
